div.pre: 1952 Ruvo (anc. Rubi), 35 km. W of Bari, (876) Apulia, 1877 Burial: c. 300 B.C. (K) Contents: 57 AR Taras: 17 Heracleia: 16 Metapontum: 19 Thurium: 1 Croton: 2 Terina: 1 Thyrrheium: 1 Disposition: unknown Fiorelli, NSc 1877, p. 64 (= 286) The only clue to date is the inclusion of a coin of Thyrrheium (a Pegasus?), which should indicate late 4th or early 3rd cent.
